x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
Cyber scams are increasing at the community level — from fake text messages and phishing calls to fraudulent social-media ads. Most victims don’t know where to report such incidents or how to warn others nearby. Local law enforcement and cyber cells often receive fragmented data, making it hard to detect patterns or respond quickly.
There is currently no centralized, community-driven platform to report, verify, and share alerts about local cyber threats in real time.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

ServiceNow Products & Capabilities

Experience & Intake

  • Employee Center / Service Portal (UI Builder) – public portal, report form, alerts feed, knowledge hub.

  • Now Mobile – quick report (camera upload), geo-alerts, push notifications.

Workflow & Integration

  • Service Catalog + Record Producers – “Report a scam,” “Publish alert.”

  • Flow Designer + Subflows – intake → dedupe → scoring → triage → publish.

  • IntegrationHub (REST/Webhooks) – inbound email/SMS, FB/WhatsApp, WHOIS/Google Safe Browsing/OTX/VirusTotal, ISP/Law-Enforcement intake.

Case/Partner Management

  • Customer/Partner Service Management (CSM) – onboard partners, SLAs, collaboration cases.

  • (Optional) Field Service Management (FSM) – if physical outreach/poster campaigns or device pickup events are needed.

Analytics & Intelligence

  • Performance Analytics – dashboards (reports by ZIP, time-to-triage, alerts issued, repeats prevented).

  • Predictive Intelligence – duplicate detection, anomaly/spam guard, hotspot prediction.

  • Knowledge Management – playbooks, scam tip sheets, “is this legit?” articles.

Trust, Security, Compliance

  • RBAC for roles (community user/moderator/analyst/partner).

  • Audit/history on alerts and evidence; retention policies; consent for contact data.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Data model & storage

Tables for reports, indicators (IoCs), alerts, partners, distributions, subscriptions

Attachments (screenshots/voicemails); size & retention limits

Geo fields (ZIP/city) for local targeting

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Data Sharing & Integration

  • Connecting with multiple partners (ISPs, law enforcement, social media, threat-intel APIs) involves different data formats, permissions, and security standards.

  • Maintaining reliable integrations for inbound and outbound alerts requires strong API governance.
